risk_description: Offline data synchronization conflicts using WatermelonDB in React Native apps may lead to data corruption or loss when technicians sync job statuses after extended offline periods.
root_cause: Complex conflict resolution logic required when multiple clients or the server update the same record (e.g., job status) simultaneously during network partitions.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a strict 'Server-Wins' conflict resolution policy for critical status updates and a 'Last-Write-Wins' for isolated notes. Design idempotent API endpoints.
contingency_plan: Implement a manual conflict resolution UI for technicians to review and merge data discrepancies if automated sync fails.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rates exceeding 1% in application logs or 'Data Consistency' alerts from the backend.

risk_description: Mobile OS (iOS/Android) aggressively killing background location processes for 'Travel Mode', preventing real-time tracking updates to the customer.
affected_tasks: WI-MOB-002: Technician Travel Mode & Background Location
root_cause: Strict battery optimization and privacy policies in modern mobile operating systems that restrict long-running background tasks.
mitigation_strategy: Implement platform-specific foreground services (Android) and 'Always Allow' location permission flows (iOS). Implement batched updates to reduce wake-ups.
contingency_plan: Fallback to 'Significant Location Change' service which is less accurate but more battery efficient and less likely to be killed.
monitoring_trigger: Gaps in GPS telemetry data > 5 minutes for active 'Travel Mode' sessions.

risk_description: Failure to meet the < 250ms P95 API latency requirement due to overhead from inter-service communication (NestJS to .NET workers) and database locking.
root_cause: Synchronous calls between microservices, unoptimized database queries, or lack of caching for static data like Product Models.
mitigation_strategy: Implement aggressive Redis caching for read-heavy data. Use Azure Service Bus for asynchronous processing of non-blocking write operations.
contingency_plan: Scale up database DTUs or vertically scale AKS nodes. Refactor critical paths to use read-replicas.
monitoring_trigger: P95 latency metrics in Azure Monitor exceeding 200ms threshold during load testing.

risk_description: Misconfiguration of Azure AD B2C custom policies leading to authentication bypass or failure to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for Admin roles.
affected_tasks: WI-SEC-001: Configure Azure AD B2C Policies
root_cause: High complexity of XML-based Identity Experience Framework policies in Azure AD B2C.
mitigation_strategy: Engage an Identity Specialist for policy review. Implement automated integration tests specifically for auth flows including MFA challenges.
contingency_plan: Revert to standard (non-custom) B2C User Flows temporarily, accepting reduced customization until policies are fixed.
monitoring_trigger: Failed login attempts spiking or successful logins without MFA claims in audit logs.

risk_description: Azure Maps API cost overruns or rate limiting affecting the Service Center Geofencing and Technician routing features.
root_cause: Inefficient client-side implementation making excessive map tile or routing requests.
mitigation_strategy: Implement client-side caching for map tiles. Use Azure API Management to set rate limits and quotas per tenant.
contingency_plan: Switch map provider to Mapbox or OpenStreetMap if Azure Maps becomes cost-prohibitive or unreliable.
monitoring_trigger: Azure cost alerts at 50%, 75%, and 90% of budget for Maps resource.

risk_description: Inability to meet the 15-minute Recovery Point Objective (RPO) during a regional outage due to replication lag or backup configuration errors.
root_cause: Misconfiguration of Azure PostgreSQL Geo-Redundant Backup or Write-Ahead Log (WAL) transmission delays.
mitigation_strategy: Enable Geo-Redundant backups and configure active geo-replication. Automate regular disaster recovery drills.
contingency_plan: Trigger manual failover to the secondary region database if automated failover fails.
monitoring_trigger: Replication lag metrics exceeding 5 minutes in Azure Monitor.

risk_description: Knowledge gap in .NET Core worker services within a predominantly Node.js/TypeScript team, leading to maintenance issues or poor code quality.
root_cause: Polyglot architecture decision requiring both NestJS and .NET skills in the same team.
mitigation_strategy: Conduct cross-training sessions. Establish strict code review guidelines requiring sign-off from the .NET Subject Matter Expert.
contingency_plan: Rewrite the OCR and SignalR workers in Node.js if the .NET maintenance burden becomes too high.
monitoring_trigger: Velocity drop in .NET related tasks or high bug density in worker services.
